content:
• Tuesday, July 17, 2012
  • VVUS

    Other drug stocks reacting after hours to the FDA's approval of Vivus' (NASDAQ:VVUS)...

    Other drug stocks reacting after hours to the FDA's approval of Vivus' (NASDAQ:VVUS) Qnexa/Qsymia: OREX +6.4%, ARNA -6.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 PM | 26 Comments
  • CTXS

    VMware's preliminary Q2 results provide a moderate AH lift to some other volatile enterprise...

    VMware's preliminary Q2 results provide a moderate AH lift to some other volatile enterprise tech names. CTXS +1.7%. FFIV +1.4%. RVBD +1.4%. RHT +1.6%. CRM +3.1%. APKT +2.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:21 PM
  • URI

    More on United Rentals (NYSE:URI): Q2 beats on a per share basis, but comes up short on revenue,...

    More on United Rentals (NYSE:URI): Q2 beats on a per share basis, but comes up short on revenue, despite a 57% Y/Y jump in total sales. Rental revenue increased 6.5% Y/Y,  but margins came in lower as time utilization rates declined slightly. The company also issued a cautious outlook for the remainder of the year. Shares -2.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • DELL

    Along with VMware, EMC is preannouncing Q2 results. Revenue of $5.31B (+10% Y/Y) beats by $20M,...

    Along with VMware, EMC is preannouncing Q2 results. Revenue of $5.31B (+10% Y/Y) beats by $20M, while EPS of $0.39 misses by $0.01. The company is reiterating its guidance for 2012 revenue of $22B and EPS of $1.70 (consensus is at $22.1B and $1.73). In addition, EMC announces CFO David Goulden has been named COO, as storage COO Pat Gelsinger takes over at VMware. Ex-VMware CEO Paul Maritz is now EMC's Chief Strategist. EMC +6.9% AH. NTAP +1.1%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • VMW

    VMware (NYSE:VMW) officially announces its CEO change. Paul Martiz is out, and Pat Gelsinger is...

    VMware (NYSE:VMW) officially announces its CEO change. Paul Martiz is out, and Pat Gelsinger is in. Maritz will become Chief Strategist at parent EMC. The company also reports preliminary Q2 revenue of $1.12B (+22% Y/Y), slightly above a $1.11B consensus, and an operating margin of 32% (above guidance of 30.255-31.25%). It expects 2012 revenue of $4.54B-$4.635B vs. a consensus of $4.59B. VMW +6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • ROVI

    Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI) -27.5% AH after warning it expects Q2 revenue of $158M and EPS of...

    Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI) -27.5% AH after warning it expects Q2 revenue of $158M and EPS of $0.35-$0.38, well below a consensus of $182.6M and $0.57. The company also now expects 2012 revenue and EPS guidance to $650M-$680M and $1.60-$1.90, below a consensus of $765.2M and $2.51. Rovi blames delays in securing patent licenses and launching new products, as well as weakness in electronics and ad spending. It thinks pending litigation will need to be settled before some companies agree to licenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • IPI

    Intrepid Potash (NYSE:IPI) +3.5% AH after estimating Q2 production of 165K-175K tons of potash...

    Intrepid Potash (NYSE:IPI) +3.5% AH after estimating Q2 production of 165K-175K tons of potash with sales of 180K-190K tons. Results include the benefit of record hoisting rates at IPI's West mine in New Mexico, where the company set three daily records for tons hoisted and processed in the month of June.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • STLY

    Stanley Furniture (NASDAQ:STLY): Q2 EPS of $2.54 may not be comparable to consensus of by...

    Stanley Furniture (NASDAQ:STLY): Q2 EPS of $2.54 may not be comparable to consensus of by -$0.08. Revenue of $24.4M (-10.9% Y/Y) misses by $2.3M. Shares -2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • WRK

    Rock-Tenn (RKT +5.1%) shares jump in the final hour before the close after Deutsche Bank says...

    Rock-Tenn (RKT +5.1%) shares jump in the final hour before the close after Deutsche Bank says its contacts indicate the packaging and paper company will announce a $50/ton containerboard and box price increase effective Aug. 1.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • FIS

    Fidelity National Information Services (NYSE:FIS): Q2 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.06. Revenue of...

    Fidelity National Information Services (NYSE:FIS): Q2 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.46B (+3.1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • ALB

    Albemarle (NYSE:ALB): Q2 EPS of $1.24 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $684.9M (-7.7% Y/Y) misses by...

    Albemarle (NYSE:ALB): Q2 EPS of $1.24 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $684.9M (-7.7% Y/Y) misses by $53M. Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • FIS

    Fidelity National Information Services (NYSE:FIS): Declares $0.20/share quarterly dividend, in...

    Fidelity National Information Services (NYSE:FIS): Declares $0.20/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 2.3%. For shareholders of record Sep 14; Payable Sep 28; ex-div date Sep 12. Shares +2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • AGNC

    American Capital Agency (NASDAQ:AGNC) announces a secondary offering of 32M shares. The firm...

    American Capital Agency (NASDAQ:AGNC) announces a secondary offering of 32M shares. The firm joins a rush of mortgage REITs taking advantage of a nice run in their stock prices to well above book value. Shares -2.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 22 Comments
  • JBHT

    Trucking company stocks slide after J.B. Hunt's (JBHT -5.4%) disappointing Q2 results raise...

    Trucking company stocks slide after J.B. Hunt's (JBHT -5.4%) disappointing Q2 results raise concerns about industry trends. SunTrust cuts peer Hub Group (HUBG -7.8%) to Neutral from Buy, citing JBHT's decelerating volume growth, and Sterne Agee cuts Werner Enterprises (WERN -3.4%) to Neutral ahead of its Q2 report this week. Also lower: PACR -4%, CHRW -1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • ENB

    Enbridge (ENB +1.5%) is upgraded to Overweight with a $45 price target, up from $41, by...

    Enbridge (ENB +1.5%) is upgraded to Overweight with a $45 price target, up from $41, by Barclays, which expects double-digit growth and total return three-year CAGR of ~15%. The firm says ENB may look expensive via traditional valuation metrics but notes the Canadian market places a premium on stocks with a solid track record and dividend growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +0.5%) announces that it will report FQ3 earnings after the...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +0.5%) announces that it will report FQ3 earnings after the market closes on August 1. GMCR printed a fresh 52-week low of $17.66 earlier today, leaving the question hanging if an earnings bomb is getting priced in.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • DIS

    Shares of Disney (DIS +3.4%) ride an upgrade from Bank of America to hit an all-time intraday...

    Shares of Disney (DIS +3.4%) ride an upgrade from Bank of America to hit an all-time intraday high of $49.92. Shrugging off a sluggish U.S. economy, the company appears to be clicking on all cylinders, with its theme parks, film studio, and media properties more synchronized than ever. As for mega-hit The Avengers, BofA says Disney shareholders could see a $0.11-a-share boost from the well-received film.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • MOS

    Fertilizer names enjoy gains after Mosaic's (MOS +5.6%) Q2 results, including better than...

    Fertilizer names enjoy gains after Mosaic's (MOS +5.6%) Q2 results, including better than expected earnings and revenues. CEO Jim Prokopanko brushes aside concerns that severe drought would hurt fertilizer demand, saying high crop prices and evidence of soil deficiencies of phosphate and potash in the farm belt would drive sales. Piggybacking MOS: POT +2.9%, CF +2.3%, AGU +1.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • LIVE

    LiveDeal (LIVE -3.9%) slumps after CEO Jon Isaac issues a letter to shareholders outlining the...

    LiveDeal (LIVE -3.9%) slumps after CEO Jon Isaac issues a letter to shareholders outlining the firm's business plan. Although positive in tone and highlighting potential deals with large companies, word that the company won't enter the daily deals market could be tipping sentiment.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • CTAS

    Shares of Cintas (CTAS -3.4%) remain firmly in the red after its FQ4 disappointed the Street....

    Shares of Cintas (CTAS -3.4%) remain firmly in the red after its FQ4 disappointed the Street. Net earnings actually rose 11% Y/Y on a continuing sales improvement from its uniform-rental business and better margins, but the company took a cautious view for the year ahead, with earnings expectations coming in at the low end.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • AZC

    Augusta Resource (AZC +9.6%) announces a 34% increase in sulfide mineral resources at its...

    Augusta Resource (AZC +9.6%) announces a 34% increase in sulfide mineral resources at its Rosemont Copper project in Arizona: "We expect this larger resource to positively contribute to the feasibility study update that is expected to be released shortly."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • TSLA

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA -6.5%) let off a little steam after making a nice run following the...

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA -6.5%) let off a little steam after making a nice run following the launch of the Model S. Short interest remains a hot topic on TSLA, with close to 27M shares at bay with an average of 15 days to cover.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR +8.8%) shares surge despite a widening Q2 loss Y/Y, as it expresses...

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR +8.8%) shares surge despite a widening Q2 loss Y/Y, as it expresses optimism about drilling activity in the shallow waters of the Gulf of Mexico. MMR expects to conduct a measurable flow test on the first Davy Jones well during the week of July 30, with commercial production shortly thereafter. MMR has invested nearly $1B in the ultradeep Davy Jones field.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • HD

    Shares of Home Depot (HD -1.8%) are a Dow laggard today with disappointing retail sales numbers...

    Shares of Home Depot (HD -1.8%) are a Dow laggard today with disappointing retail sales numbers and a Janney downgrade holding more weight with traders over the seemingly-positive surge in homebuilder confidence.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • MODL

    M*Modal (MODL +3.2%), which has agreed to be sold to JPMorgan's P-E arm for $14/share, jumps...

    M*Modal (MODL +3.2%), which has agreed to be sold to JPMorgan's P-E arm for $14/share, jumps after disclosing it received a $17/share offer from a competitor it refers to as "Party A," but turned it down due to uncertainty about timing and antitrust issues. There's a good chance the company is Nuance (NUAN -1%), which is already a giant in the clinical transcription space. M*Modal traded as high as $14.99, and is currently moving at $14.51. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • BTU

    Coal company shares are turning in another dismal day ahead of several earnings reports next...

    Coal company shares are turning in another dismal day ahead of several earnings reports next week. Analysts expect quarterly EPS at Peabody (BTU -1.5%), the largest coal producer by output, of $0.53 on revenue of $2.06B vs. $1.05 and $2.01B a year ago. The outlook for Arch Coal (ACI -3.7%) and Alpha Natural (ANR -4.4%) looks equally depressing.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (URBN +3.6%) trades higher after Morgan Stanley adds the Overweight-rated name...

    Urban Outfitters (URBN +3.6%) trades higher after Morgan Stanley adds the Overweight-rated name to its Best Ideas list. In a bullish note, Morgan says it sees a break-out in shares from a tight trading range as new management initiatives start to register.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -2.9%) and Zynga (ZNGA -7%) dive following a Capstone Investments report claiming...

    Facebook (FB -2.9%) and Zynga (ZNGA -7%) dive following a Capstone Investments report claiming Facebook's U.S. users fell 1.1% over the last 6 months. Capstone adds Facebook's growth was minimal or negative in 14 of the 23 countries in which its penetration rate is above 50%. The report backs up recent data suggesting U.S. saturation, and drives home Facebook's dependence on less profitable emerging markets to drive user growth. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 4 Comments
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +0.2%) shares reverse course after suffering heavy losses earlier and hover around...

    Vivus (VVUS +0.2%) shares reverse course after suffering heavy losses earlier and hover around zero after USA Today reports that the FDA has approved its Qnexa/Qysemia diet drug. However, no other news organizations appear to have reported the story, and it's not on the FDA website. Update: the linked-story in this MC seems to have been taken down. Vivus shares -0.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 18 Comments
  • ALTH

    Allos (NASDAQ:ALTH) storms 19.6% higher after Spectrum (SPPI -0.9%) provides reassurances that...

    Allos (NASDAQ:ALTH) storms 19.6% higher after Spectrum (SPPI -0.9%) provides reassurances that its $206M+ acquisition of Allos is progressing well and that the company was "very happy with everything." Allos' shares plunged 20% yesterday on rumors that the deal had fallen through.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM -3.6%) is off on news of Samsung's purchase of most of rival CSR's (CSRE +29.9%)...

    Broadcom (BRCM -3.6%) is off on news of Samsung's purchase of most of rival CSR's (CSRE +29.9%) mobile chip business, but has bounced from its lows. FBR defends Broadcom by noting its phone connectivity business only makes up 6%-10% of sales, and that CSR's chips will likely be aimed at low-end phones. Deutsche argues there isn't much near-term risk to sales, and that Broadcom's Wi-Fi/Bluetooth combo chips have performance and cost advantages over CSR's discrete solutions.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • GMXRQ

    GMX Resources (GMXR +2.5%) says it has engaged Global Hunter Securities as financial...

    GMX Resources (GMXR +2.5%) says it has engaged Global Hunter Securities as financial advisor in connection with a proposed sale of a portion of its Cotton Valley Sand liquids rich natural gas properties in East Texas.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • LH

    Piper Jaffray says slow employment growth could drive weaker than expected organic volume growth...

    Piper Jaffray says slow employment growth could drive weaker than expected organic volume growth at Labcorp (LH -2.2%). The firm cuts its rating to Neutral and lowers its price target to $96 from $100. Separately, William Blair also downgraded the stock to Market Perform prior to the open.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • CAM

    Cameron (NYSE:CAM) selects a Broadwind Energy (BWEN +9.8%) subsidiary to supply enclosed drives...

    Cameron (NYSE:CAM) selects a Broadwind Energy (BWEN +9.8%) subsidiary to supply enclosed drives and open gearing for use on offshore oil platforms. Shipments are expected to begin in Q4 2012 and continue into 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR +3.9%) powers higher, as its warning of weaker than expected Q2 earnings...

    Nabors Industries (NBR +3.9%) powers higher, as its warning of weaker than expected Q2 earnings is not a surprise. "E&P companies are extracting significant pricing concessions to the detriment of oilfield services companies," Simmons analyst Bill Herbert says, citing a "significant compression" in oil prices threatening the oil drilling boom that has buoyed the entire industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • ANTH

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +25%) continues to soar again today after saying that its...

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH +25%) continues to soar again today after saying that its final set of clinical data from Phase 2b PEARL-SC trials successfully met its primary endpoint in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus. The tests showed that sustained and greater treatment using PEARL-SC scored higher in the SELENA-SLEDAI disease-scoring index versus a placebo, and that patients reported longer periods between symptom flareups.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • MFRM

    Shares of Mattress Firm (MFRM -14.5%) get crushed after the company lowers its full-year revenue...

    Shares of Mattress Firm (MFRM -14.5%) get crushed after the company lowers its full-year revenue and same-store sales guidance. The weak sales outlook is disturbing enough, but after Mattress Firm backed its outlook just a month ago, UBS notes the creditability of management may be at issue. Sector movers: TPX -2.4%, SCSS -8.6%, ZZ -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • FTEK

    Fuel Tech (FTEK +17.1%) is awarded a $36.6M air pollution control contract, the largest in the...

    Fuel Tech (FTEK +17.1%) is awarded a $36.6M air pollution control contract, the largest in the company's history, with a major utility in Chile. The contract includes turnkey installation of Low NOx Burners and Over-Fire Air systems and mill modernization for six coal-fired units.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW -4.5%) tanks on a report Paul Maritz, who has overseen the company's emergence as an...

    VMware (VMW -4.5%) tanks on a report Paul Maritz, who has overseen the company's emergence as an IT giant, will be replaced by EMC's (EMC -1.3%) Pat Gelsinger. Ahead of the scoop, GigaOm noted VMware has seen many execs depart. One theory: EMC is upset VMware has lost ground in virtualization to Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) and others as the company pays more attention to complementary software. But The Register's sources think the move is all about growing the other businesses. (cloud spinoff)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 2 Comments
  • REXX

    Rex Energy's (REXX -2.8%) Q2 production jumped 78% but revenue fell to $27.7M from $28.3M in the...

    Rex Energy's (REXX -2.8%) Q2 production jumped 78% but revenue fell to $27.7M from $28.3M in the year-ago quarter due to weak prices. Production rose to 62.5MM cfe/day in the quarter, with oil and natural gas liquids accounting for 26% of output.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • TGT

    Citi has a lot to say about retail today (previous: JCP) with analyst Deborah Weinswig tipping...

    Citi has a lot to say about retail today (previous: JCP) with analyst Deborah Weinswig tipping off that early checks show July same-store sales are weak for major retailers and margin pressure could be in store as inventories rise. Rating revisions: Target (TGT -0.8%) to Neutral from Buy; Macy's (M +0.2%) price target clipped by a buck to $37 and EPS estimates dropped; Kohl's (KSS +2.2%) sales and earnings estimates dropped.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • BIDU

    Chinese Internet stocks, many of whom fell yesterday on worries about the Middle Kingdom's...

    Chinese Internet stocks, many of whom fell yesterday on worries about the Middle Kingdom's growth outlook, are falling harder today. BIDU -4.9%. SINA -7.9%. YOKU -9.1%. TUDO -9%. SOHU -5.4%. RENN -5.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 3 Comments
  • LIME

    Lime Energy's (LIME -52.2%) audit committee determines that some revenue has been improperly...

    Lime Energy's (LIME -52.2%) audit committee determines that some revenue has been improperly recorded, and non-existent revenue may have been recorded. As a result, 2010 and 2011 annual reports as well as its Q1 2012 report cannot be relied on and must be restated.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    It's a big day for Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS), with the FDA due to vote on whether to approve the...

    It's a big day for Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS), with the FDA due to vote on whether to approve the company's diet drug Qnexa. After rising 5.7% yesterday, shares are -8.4% on what must be intense nerves, although SA author Qineqt advises buying the stock as an approval is likely. Of Vivus' rivals, Orexigen is (ORE) is -4.5% and Arena is +1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -3.6%) makes new lows yet again after getting hit with a downgrade to Underperform by...

    Nokia (NOK -3.6%) makes new lows yet again after getting hit with a downgrade to Underperform by Jefferies. The firm cites Microsoft's hardware development efforts (though no smartphone is in the pipeline for now), the inability to upgrade current Lumia phones to Windows Phone 8, the emphasizing of rival hardware by carriers, and expectations of further losses. Alcatel-Lucent's warning probably isn't helping Nokia's cause either.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 9 Comments
  • JCP

    Citigroup removes J.C. Penney (JCP --1.6%) from its Top Picks Live list and slashes the price...

    Citigroup removes J.C. Penney (JCP --1.6%) from its Top Picks Live list and slashes the price target on shares to $24 from $40. One of the issues (of many) with the company's "transformation" is that new product lines aren't viewed as likely to click with back-to-school shoppers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • EDU

    Shares of New Oriental Education & Technology (EDU -27.2%) crater after a SEC investigation into...

    Shares of New Oriental Education & Technology (EDU -27.2%) crater after a SEC investigation into the company is announced on an earnings CC. (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • PVAC

    Penn Virginia (PVA -1.6%) agrees to sell all its Appalachian assets excluding the Marcellus...

    Penn Virginia (PVA -1.6%) agrees to sell all its Appalachian assets excluding the Marcellus Shale to an undisclosed buyer for $100M in cash. PVA says the deal will reduce its debt, improve its liquidity and fund further investment in its Eagle Ford Shale play. The sale will reduce PVA's production by ~2.9B cubic feet of natural gas equivalent this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • NOK

    Today's crash in Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -17.9%), the result of more ugly earnings news, is leading...

    Today's crash in Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -17.9%), the result of more ugly earnings news, is leading many to question its survival, at least without a major restructuring. Nomura's Stuart Jeffrey notes Alcatel's remarks about failing to reach its operating margin guidance suggest it will struggle to turn cash flow positive. Goldman has argued liquidity pressures could arrive by 2013. Plenty of other telecom equipment names have warned. CIEN -2.9%. TLAB -2.4%. (Q1 miss)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • APOL

    Shares of Apollo Group (APOL -2.4%) show weakness as rumors circulate that David Einhorn has...

    Shares of Apollo Group (APOL -2.4%) show weakness as rumors circulate that David Einhorn has taken a short position. Despite Einhorn's own admission that the price swings based on his actions tend to be absurd, a whole cottage industry of Einhorn watchers has emerged.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • CGG-OLD

    CGGVeritas (CGV +5.9%) says it began acquiring its first StagSeis dual-vessel, long-offset...

    CGGVeritas (CGV +5.9%) says it began acquiring its first StagSeis dual-vessel, long-offset multi-client full-azimuth survey in the Keathley Canyon area of the Gulf of Mexico. The 3D seismic data survey is the first phase in a multi-client program CGV says it will conduct in the Gulf over the next few years.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • IMAX

    Shares of IMAX gain 4.7% in early trading as investors jump into the company as it maintains an...

    Shares of IMAX gain 4.7% in early trading as investors jump into the company as it maintains an aggressive global growth track with China a big target. This week sees the opening of The Dark Knight Rises, notable for its significant amount of footage shot with IMAX cameras. Director Christopher Nolan is an outspoken proponent that the IMAX format - not 3D - is the future of cinema.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • DNKN

    Shares of Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) fall 2.5% premarket after JPMorgan calls valuation "fair"...

    Shares of Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) fall 2.5% premarket after JPMorgan calls valuation "fair" and takes its rating down to Neutral on the name. In comparison to other high-growth restaurant stocks such as Starbucks, Chipotle, and Yum Brands that have been clipped by 10%-15% from their recent highs - Dunkin' Brands trades just 4% off of its own high.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • SSNLF

    Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) is acquiring the mobile phone connectivity and location chip ops of U.K's...

    Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) is acquiring the mobile phone connectivity and location chip ops of U.K's CSR (CSRE +34.1%) for £200M ($319M). The acquisition covers Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, and GPS chips, and is arguably a threat to Samsung supplier Broadcom (BRCM), which has long competed with CSR in these areas. It also provides Samsung with 21 patents that could be useful in its disputes with Apple. The deal comes 6 weeks after Samsung bought Wi-Fi chipmaker Nanoradio. BRCM -1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Stock futures are higher ahead of Ben Bernanke's testimony to Congress, with...

    Market preview: Stock futures are higher ahead of Ben Bernanke's testimony to Congress, with markets optimistic that he'll indicate more easing. With inflation stagnant, he has the cover. S&P benchmark +0.3%. State Street slumps 4.85% following earnings, although Mattel jumps 5.6%, while Yahoo is just +1.3% after its appointment of a shiny new CEO. Later: NAHB Housing Market Index, Intel's earnings
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • WEST

    Westinghouse Solar (NASDAQ:WEST) +46.2% premarket after announcing it was selected by Comtec...

    Westinghouse Solar (NASDAQ:WEST) +46.2% premarket after announcing it was selected by Comtec Distributing as the company's exclusive supplier of solar power systems. Comtec has a network of dealers serving markets in most of the western U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • DGIT

    Premarket gainers: DGIT +24%. PPHM +12%. JOEZ +10%. MAT +7%. Losers: EDU -33%. ALU -18%. AUQ...

    Premarket gainers: DGIT +24%. PPHM +12%. JOEZ +10%. MAT +7%.
    Losers: EDU -33%. ALU -18%. AUQ -8%. OTC:ANTH -7%. JBHT -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • MILL

    Miller Energy (NYSE:MILL) -12.6% premarket after reporting an FQ4 loss of $0.20/share vs. a loss...

    Miller Energy (NYSE:MILL) -12.6% premarket after reporting an FQ4 loss of $0.20/share vs. a loss of $0.05/share in the prior-year period; revenues rose 38% Y/Y to $8.9M. For FY2012 ended April 30, net loss was $0.48/share on revenues of $35.4M (+55% Y/Y).
